newsitem.title: USA: NYPA still sees Indian Point nuke restart mid-Feb.
newsitem.headline: NYPA still sees Indian Point nuke restart mid-Feb.

text.p: New York Power Authority said Thursday it still expects its 965 megawatt (MW) Indian Point nuclear unit 3 to restart in mid-February.
"We're still looking at about mid-February. We're finishing the repairs on the two PORVs (power-operated relief valves)," said an onsite plant spokesman.
He added engineers were also resealing the manway to the unit's reactor coolant system.
Nuclear Regulatory Commission, in its daily plant status report Thursday, gave a restart date of February 25 for Indian Point 3.
Indian Point 3 was originally shut January 18 to repair its feedwater heaters.
The nearby 975 MW Indian Point 2 was scheduled to resume service within the next several weeks after being shut January 27 for support work on the non-nuclear side of the plant.
